intro: Eriocaulon thwaitesii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to form dense colonies, contributing to soil stabilization and habitat for aquatic organisms. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
